intro: Thrixspermum angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thrixspermum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its narrow, linear leaves are arranged alternately along the stem, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Thrixspermum angustifolium is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
